job.title: Software Dev Intern - AI / Machine Learning

tailored_cvs.job_description:
DescriptionDo you want to solve real customer problems through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on scalable services in a collaborative team environment? Do you want to see your code directly impact millions of customers worldwide?At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. Customer obsession is part of our company DNA, which has made us one of the world's most beloved brands.Our Software Development Engineer (SDE) interns use modern technology to solve complex problems while seeing their work's impact first-hand. The challenges SDE interns solve at Amazon are meaningful and influence millions of customers, sellers, and products globally. We seek individuals passionate about creating new products, features, and services while managing ambiguity in an environment where development cycles are measured in weeks, not years.At Amazon, we believe in ownership at every level. As an SDE intern, you'll own the entire lifecycle of your code - from design through deployment and ongoing operations. This ownership mindset, combined with our commitment to operational excellence, ensures we deliver the highest quality solutions for our customers.We're looking for curious minds who think big and want to define tomorrow's technology. At Amazon, you'll grow into the high-impact engineer you know you can be, supported by a culture of learning and mentorship. Every day brings exciting new challenges and opportunities for personal growth.Amazon internships across all seasons are full-time positions, and interns should expect to work in office, Monday-Friday, up to 40 hours per week typically between 8am-5pm. Specific team norms around working hours will be communicated by your manager. Interns should not have conflicts such as classes or other employment during the Amazon work-day. Applicants should have a minimum of one quarter/semester/trimester remaining in their studies after their internship concludes.Key job responsibilities Collaborate and communicate effectively with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to design, build, and operate innovative products and services that delight our customers, while participating in technical discussions to drive solutions forward. Design and develop scalable solutions using cloud-native architectures and microservices in a large distributed computing environment. Participate in code reviews and contribute to technical documentation. Build and maintain resilient distributed systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, and cost-effective. Leverage and contribute to the development of GenAI and AI-powered tools to enhance development productivity while staying current with emerging technologies. Write clean, maintainable code following best practices and design patterns. Work in an agile environment practicing CI/CD principles while participating in operational responsibilities including on-call duties. Demonstrate operational excellence through monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving production issues.A day in the lifeAs an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor and will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead critical projects early in your career.The team requires an internship duration of 3 to 6 months.In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real-world setting.Basic Qualifications Must be 18 years of age or older Education Requirements (must meet one): o Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Information Systems, or related STEM fields [degrees can be updated based on regional variations] o Completed Bachelor's or Graduate degree in specified fields Demonstrated experience with at least one general-purpose programming language such as Java, Python, C++, C#, Go, Rust, or TypeScript Demonstrated experience one or more of the following: o Data structures implementation o Basic algorithm development o Object-oriented design principles Experience with AI/ML technologiesPreferred Qualifications Experience in GenAI and Agent service development using LLM/VLM. Previous technical internship(s) or demonstrated project experience Experience with one or more of the following: o AI tools for development productivity o Cloud platforms (preferably AWS) o Database systems (SQL and NoSQL) o Contributing to open-source projects o Version control systems o Debugging and troubleshooting complex systems Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Demonstrated ability to learn and adapt to new technologies quickly Basic understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC)Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.Company - Amazon Business EU SARL (UK) - H91Job ID: A3130532
        


        
            Show more

key_requirements: AI/Machine Learning focus (GenAI, LLM/VLM, Agent services)
Strong programming skills (Python, Java, C++, C#, Go, Rust, or TypeScript)
Data structures, algorithms, Object-Oriented Design (OOD)
Scalable solutions, cloud-native architectures, microservices, distributed computing
Experience with cloud platforms (preferably AWS)
Database systems (SQL and NoSQL)
Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Agile, CI/CD, Version Control
Problem-solving, analytical skills, adaptability to new technologies
Ownership mindset and customer obsession
job_analysis.selected_projects_reasoning: Selected 'DocuCare AI' for its direct alignment with GenAI, LLM/VLM, RAG, and cloud-native architecture using Google Gemini/Anthropic Claude. This directly addresses the preferred qualifications. 'Smart Student Job Agent Platform (Unihustle)' was chosen for its demonstration of algorithmic matching engines (core AI concept), distributed systems (Celery, Redis), and robust backend development with Python/PostgreSQL, showcasing skills in scalable solutions and algorithm development. 'FlowerGen' from the generic CV was included to further emphasize hands-on Generative AI experience with Stable Diffusion and LoRA, and practical optimization skills, reinforcing a strong foundation in GenAI model development and deployment. Together, these projects provide a comprehensive showcase of GenAI, algorithmic AI, distributed systems, and a strong modern tech stack relevant to Amazon's requirements.

tailored_cv.professional_summary: Enthusiastic and adaptable Master's student in Artificial Intelligence, passionate about building scalable AI/ML solutions and distributed systems. Proficient in Python, Generative AI (LLMs, Diffusion Models), and full-stack development, with a strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and Object-Oriented Design. Eager to apply a customer-obsessed, ownership mindset to design, develop, and deploy innovative products that leverage AI/ML to solve complex problems and directly impact millions of customers.

Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learni: Generative AI (LLM, VLM, Stable Diffusion, LoRA)

experience.title: Technology Foundations Virtual Experience
experience.description: Simulated end-to-end Agile SDLC using DevOps and automation tools.
achievements: Executed an end-to-end Agile SDLC simulation, demonstrating proficiency in DevOps and automation tools.
Debugged and optimised Python scripts, improving runtime efficiency by 30% through algorithmic enhancements.

projects.title: DocuCare AI - AI-Powered Medical Document Management System
projects.description: Modern web application leveraging AI for intelligent medical document management and analysis.
achievements: Developed a server-side AI pipeline utilizing Google Gemini 1.5 Flash for advanced OCR and precise medical data extraction from diverse documents.
Implemented an intelligent Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) chat system with vector embeddings to enable natural language querying of health records.
Re-architected the backend infrastructure to a 100% free-tier compatible Supabase stack, demonstrating cloud-native development and cost optimization.
Built a robust and scalable frontend using Next.js 14 App Router and Server Actions for secure data handling and optimal performance.

projects.title: Smart Student Job Agent Platform (Unihustle)
projects.description: Comprehensive job aggregation and intelligent matching platform for students.
achievements: Architected a specific matching engine leveraging weighted vectors to align student availability, location, and skills with job requirements.
Engineered asynchronous background worker pipelines using Celery and Redis to efficiently scrape external job boards without impacting platform performance.
Designed a normalized PostgreSQL schema with SQLAlchemy ORM, enabling complex data modeling and efficient querying of job data.
Developed a high-performance, reactive frontend with React 19 and React Hook Form, ensuring a seamless user experience.

projects.title: FlowerGen | Text-to-Image Generation System
projects.description: Generative AI model for realistic text-to-image generation.
achievements: Built a generative AI model using Stable Diffusion and LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) for efficient and high-quality text-to-image synthesis.
Optimised GPU training on an RTX 3050, reducing memory usage by 25% while maintaining model fidelity and training speed.
Integrated real-time data pipelines to enhance interactive user experience and model responsiveness during generation.

tailored_cvs.job_description: Software Developer InternLocation: Hybrid - Online / BrightonType: Training-to-Employment ProgrammeCost: FREE - for West Sussex and Brighton and Hove residents onlyNext Start Date: 7 January 2026Note: Please DO NOT apply if you do not live in West Sussex or Brighton. You will bot be eligible for funding and we will not be able to process your applicstion. About the OpportunityAre you a West Sussex or Brighton & Hove based computer science graduate, self-taught coder, or bootcamp completer who still can’t land that first job in tech?TechNative Digital is offering a fully funded, intensive, 12-week Software Development Bootcamp designed specifically for aspiring developers who can already code, but need real-world experience to gain industry level skills and a polished portfolio, and structured careers support to break into the industry.This is not an entry-level course — it’s a finishing school for developers who are “stuck at the start”.By joining, you will be enrolled as a Software Developer Intern, working on real projects, coached by industry developers, and guaranteed at least one job interview with a partnered local employer.This opportunity is fully funded by the Department for Education if you live in West Sussex or Brighton and Hove.Who This Is ForWe are looking for people who meet one or more of the following:Computer Science graduates who haven’t yet secured a first developer roleCoding bootcamp graduates missing the last piece of confidence or experienceSelf-taught developers with solid GitHub projectsCareer changers with a good foundation in HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptDevelopers who have been actively applying for junior roles without successYou must already know the basics of web development. This programme takes you from “can code” → ready for paid work.What You’ll LearnOur curriculum is co-designed with real employers to give you the skills needed for work.You’ll cover:Core Technical SkillsHTML, CSS, accessibility, responsive web designJavaScript (ES6+), DOM manipulation, async patternsIntro to React (components, hooks)Backend fundamentals using Node.js & ExpressWorking with APIsDatabases (PostgreSQL basics)Git, GitHub, branching, pull requestsAgile workflows & real project deliveryProfessional & Workplace SkillsWriting clean, industry-standard codeWorking in dev teams, sprints, and stand-upsPair programming & code reviewsDebugging and problem solvingCareer & Employability SkillsYou also receive full careers coaching from Software recruitment guru David Robers from Crushing Digital (https://crushing.digital/), including:LinkedIn optimisationCV & portfolio buildingMock interviews with real employersGuidance on applications and tech testsAccess to real junior developer vacancies through our employer networkWhat You’ll Be DoingAs a Software Developer Intern on the Bootcamp, you will:Build multiple real-world projects for your portfolioContribute to a team capstone projectWork with industry tutors from companies such as DabApps, Certn, and Shopify partnersAttend live sessions twice per week plus project timeReceive support from a Learning Support Assistant and senior tutorsThis hands-on experience follows the same rhythms as a real dev role: sprints, retros, ticket systems, stand-ups, pull requests, and feedback cycles.Programme StructureDuration: 12 weekFormat: Hybrid, live sessionsDelivery model: Wednesday online, Thursdays in personExtra support: Slack community, 1:1 check-ins, learning supportStart Date: 7 January 2026EligibilityThis programme is fully funded if you:Live in West Sussex or Brighton and HoveAre aged 19+Have the legal right to work in the UKCan commit to the 12-week scheduleAlready have basic coding skills (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)To ApplyLInk to our simple Stage 1 application form and we will send full details of the programme: https://share-eu1.hsforms.com/1dVFH9CwcSI2VONRBB4T6lwf0y5yFor more information the Tech Finishing School and our range of bootcamp programmes link to https://technativedigital.com/#/course/software-development Show more Show less

job_analysis.selected_projects_reasoning: Selected 'DocuCare AI - AI-Powered Medical Document Management System' for its strong demonstration of React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and database interaction (Supabase, a SQL-based platform comparable to PostgreSQL). It also showcases API integration and robust frontend/backend architecture, directly aligning with the job's focus on modern web development. 'Smart Student Job Agent Platform (Unihustle)' was chosen because it directly features React, PostgreSQL (a key requirement), and a Flask/Python backend, demonstrating full-stack capabilities, asynchronous processing, and complex database schema design. Both projects collectively cover the core technical stack and practical experience emphasized by the job description, especially for a 'finishing school' program targeting developers with existing foundational skills.

tailored_cv.professional_summary: Motivated and adaptable Computer Science graduate with a strong foundation in modern web development technologies including JavaScript (ES6+), React.js, Node.js, Express.js, and SQL databases. Eager to transition foundational coding skills into industry-level experience by contributing to real-world projects within an Agile development environment. Proven ability in building scalable solutions, collaborating in team settings, writing clean, maintainable code, and rapidly debugging complex systems. Passionate about continuous learning and honing practical expertise in web application development, aiming to deliver high-quality results.

tailored_cvs.job_description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.This internship is an exclusive opportunity for UK top students to dive into a dynamic, innovative environment. It will run from June to September 2026, offering participants the opportunity to make a real impact while gaining invaluable hands-on experience and professional growth.A few examples of your responsibilitiesMaster your toolkit. By working across diverse tech stacks, you’ll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust—you’ll show that true expertise isn’t about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.Build stuff that matters. Regardless of your seniority, you’ll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You’ll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.Simplify relentlessly. Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future-proof solutions.What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer individuals at the start of their career an annual salary of £85,797 in London and €66,065 elsewhere in Europe. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £112,189 and £250,512 in London, and €107,837 and €188,848 elsewhere in Europe. Compensation varies by location and expected impact, and grows rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into greater contributions. For individuals who demonstrate exceptional capability, we may offer compensation that extends beyond the usual ranges to reflect their higher expected impact. If you're offered a permanent contract, you'll also be able receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.Commitment & contractInternship. Full-time.LocationLondon (UK) or remote in selected countries.The selection processIf you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.Before you applyIf you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.
        


        
            Show more
          

          



        
            Show less

key_requirements: Strong reasoning ability and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in Python and other diverse tech stacks
Experience with building scalable, maintainable, and efficient software
Focus on simplifying complex systems and optimizing performance
Autonomy and ownership in project development (ideation to execution)
Understanding of various architectures (monolithic, microservices, REST APIs)
Drive, ambition, and a collaborative team spirit
job_analysis.selected_projects_reasoning: Selected 'DocuCare AI' for its direct relevance to advanced AI/ML applications (Gemini, Claude, RAG, vector embeddings), modern web stack (Next.js), and backend re-architecture for scalability and cost-efficiency, demonstrating strong engineering principles aligned with Bending Spoons' 'simplify relentlessly' and 'build stuff that matters' ethos. 'Smart Student Job Agent Platform (Unihustle)' was chosen for its robust backend engineering with Python (Flask), database management (PostgreSQL), asynchronous processing (Celery, Redis), and algorithmic matching, showcasing problem-solving and scalable system design. 'FlowerGen | Text-to-Image Generation System' provides hands-on experience with cutting-edge Generative AI models (Stable Diffusion, LoRA) and performance optimization, explicitly demonstrating Python-based ML development and efficiency gains, aligning with 'master your toolkit' and 'simplify relentlessly' through optimization.

tailored_cv.professional_summary: Highly motivated and adaptable Software Engineer with a strong foundation in AI/ML, Python, and scalable system design, currently pursuing a Master's in Artificial Intelligence. Adept at translating complex challenges into efficient, maintainable, and impactful technical solutions, from ideation to deployment. Proficient across the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) with hands-on experience in modern web stacks, generative AI models, and robust backend services. Passionate about continuous learning, optimizing performance, and crafting minimalist architectures to deliver high-quality results in dynamic environments. Eager to contribute to a driven team and build software that matters at scale.

job.title: CareerStart@SAS 2026 - Customer Facing Intern – AI, Data Science & Risk Management

tailored_cvs.job_description:
CareerStart@SAS Program | Customer Advisory UK Customer Facing Intern – AI, Data Science & Risk Management Marlow-HybridNice to meet you! We’re a leader in data and AI. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence – and questions into answers.    If you’re looking for a dynamic, fulfilling career with flexibility and a world-class employee experience, you’ll find it here. We’re recognized around the world for our inclusive, meaningful culture and innovative technologies by organizations like Fast Company, Forbes, Newsweek and more.What You’ll DoLooking for *that* internship? The game-changing one that’ll help you learn, grow, and chart your path forward? You’ll find it at SAS. Our interns aren’t coffee runners – they do real, meaningful work. Our AP EMEA CareerStart@SAS program is focused on development, culture, and community. We’ll help you grow professionally, find (or further) your passion, and make memorable connections that last beyond the program!   Our Northern European Solutions Team is a group of technical and business experts who help customers understand, adopt, and gain value from SAS’ AI solutions. We sit between sales and delivery, acting as trusted advisors who make sure that what SAS sells meets the requirements our customers have and is delivered successfully so creates positive impact.We operate across UK, Ireland and the Nordics – supporting a range of industries including Banking, Public Sector and Commercial sectors such as Telcos and Retail.As An Intern, You Might Assist in designing and delivering data-driven AI solutions for customers, proving how our solutions solve real-world customer problems.  Analyse client data to identify trends and provide insights to support business decision-making.  You might publish a blog or two and support experts in your team in sharing knowledge on certain technical features to other colleagues.  Participate in client meetings, asking questions to understand how their business operates today and then helping to translate their business needs into technical solutions.  Work with cross-functional teams (within the UK and also globally) to create impactful presentations and software demos that showcase SAS’s capabilities.  And you will definitely have lots of opportunity to attend courses to learn and then get hands-on with our industry leading AI tools.  Examples of SAS AI and Risk Solutions;  When someone applies for a loan or a credit increase, SAS checks their risk quickly and accurately. It uses advanced analytics and machine learning to decide if it’s safe to approve. It also helps companies manage their entire portfolio of customers, so they can reduce losses.  Stress testing runs “what if” scenarios to see how a company would cope in tough times. This is important and a legal requirement for banks.  Model management makes sure predictive models are accurate and follow rules. As well as ensuring that any AI and ML is ethical and fair.  Imagine a brain for business decisions that combines rules (like “don’t lend to someone with bad credit”) with AI models to make consistent, explainable decisions. It works across all customer touchpoints - apps, websites, branches - so the experience for consumers is smooth and fast. Required Qualifications Degree Type: Bachelor’s, Master’s  Targeted majors: Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Financial Management, Business Analytics, or related fields.  Proficiency in at least one programming language used for data analysis (SAS, Python, R, SQL). You’re curious, passionate, authentic, and accountable. These are our values  and influence everything we do.  Strong communication skills – both written and verbal.  Leadership abilities. Your past experiences demonstrate you’ll take initiative and go above and beyond the call of duty.  You’re interested in the future of AI and embrace technology. Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with data visualization and programming languages.  Knowledge of industry best practices or experience in customer-focused roles. CareerStart Program dates: Tentatively April 1 – September 30 Location Expected to be on campus at SAS’ UK HQ in Marlow, Buckinghamshire for at least 2 days a week. Perks of the job  Work with (and learn from) the best. As a SAS intern, you’ll get face time with our top executives!    Free SAS programming training and certification.      Your well-being matters, and that’s why we support all dimensions of your well-being by offering programs that reduce stress and distractions to help you stay healthy and productive.  This includes an on-site and remote Work/Life Center staffed by master’s level Social Workers and an Employee Assistance Program.   We work hard, but we like to play hard, too. Enjoy hackathons, social events and other opportunities to connect + engage.     Diverse and inclusive  At SAS, it’s not about fitting into our culture – it’s about adding to it. We believe our people make the difference. Our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. Our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it’s essential to who we are. To put it plainly: you are welcome here.     Additional InformationTo qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in UK, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status. SAS is an equal opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process. SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. If you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, or on behalf of SAS, please contact Recruitingsupport@sas.com .

key_requirements: Proficiency in Python (or R, SQL) for data analysis
Experience with AI/ML solutions and tools
Ability to analyze client data to identify trends and provide insights
Skills in translating business needs into technical solutions
Strong communication skills (written, verbal, presentations, demos)
Interest in AI, Data Science & Risk Management
Familiarity with data visualization
Problem-solving, initiative, collaboration
job_analysis.selected_projects_reasoning: Selected DocuCare AI for its direct application of advanced AI models (Gemini, Claude, RAG, vector embeddings) to medical data extraction and intelligent querying, demonstrating strong ability to build end-to-end AI-powered solutions and extract insights from complex data. Smart Student Job Agent Platform (Unihustle) was chosen for its emphasis on Python, algorithmic matching engines, data pipelines (Celery, Redis), and robust database design (PostgreSQL), highlighting data analysis, engineering, and problem-solving skills crucial for data-driven roles. FlowerGen, from the generic CV, was retained due to its clear demonstration of hands-on Generative AI (Stable Diffusion, LoRA) and Python expertise, showcasing an embrace of cutting-edge AI technologies. These three projects collectively provide comprehensive evidence across AI model implementation, data engineering, analytics, and solution development, directly aligning with the internship's focus on AI, Data Science, and Risk Management, and customer-facing solution delivery. The KanSync project, being primarily full-stack web development, was deemed less relevant than the chosen AI/Data Science focused projects for this specific role.

tailored_cv.professional_summary: Highly motivated Master's student in Artificial Intelligence with a robust foundation in **Python** and a passion for developing **data-driven AI/ML solutions**. Proven ability to **analyze complex data**, extract actionable **insights**, and **translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions**. Eager to leverage strong communication, problem-solving, and collaborative skills in a customer-facing role to drive adoption and value from cutting-edge AI, Data Science, and Risk Management technologies.

experience.title: Salesforce Administrator Intern
experience.description: Administered Salesforce CRM, focusing on automation and data management to enhance business operations.
achievements: Automated Salesforce workflows and validation rules, improving CRM data accuracy by 20% and operational efficiency.
Designed and implemented travel management modules with interactive dashboards, providing enhanced reporting and visibility for data-driven decision-making.

Collaborated cross-functionally with stakeholders to gather business requirements and translate them into scalable technical configurations, demonstrating strong communication and problem-solving skills.

experience.title: Technology Foundations Virtual Experience
experience.description: Participated in an Agile SDLC simulation focused on DevOps and automation, gaining practical experience in software development practices.
achievements: Completed an end-to-end Agile SDLC simulation, gaining practical experience with DevOps and automation tools.
Debugged and optimised Python scripts, improving runtime efficiency by 30% through meticulous code analysis and refactoring.
Presented complex algorithmic solutions with clear flow diagrams, enhancing technical communication and stakeholder understanding.

projects.title: DocuCare AI - AI-Powered Medical Document Management System
projects.description: Developed an AI-powered web application for intelligent medical document management and insights generation.
achievements: Developed a server-side AI pipeline utilizing Google Gemini 1.5 Flash for advanced Optical Character Recognition (OCR) and precise medical data extraction from diverse documents.

Implemented an intelligent Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) chat system using vector embeddings to enable natural language querying and contextual summarization of health records, providing actionable insights.
Re-architected the backend infrastructure to a 100% free-tier compatible stack using Supabase, demonstrating scalable and cost-efficient system design.

projects.title: Smart Student Job Agent Platform (Unihustle)
projects.description: Architected a comprehensive job aggregation and matching platform for students, automating local search based on availability and skills.
achievements: Architected a specific matching engine utilizing weighted vectors to precisely align student availability, location, and skills with job requirements, optimizing job recommendations.

Engineered asynchronous background worker pipelines with Celery and Redis to efficiently scrape external job boards, ensuring high performance and real-time data aggregation without impacting user experience.
Designed a normalized PostgreSQL schema with SQLAlchemy ORM, modeling complex relationships for robust data storage and retrieval, essential for data analysis and reporting.

projects.title: FlowerGen | Text-to-Image Generation System
projects.description: Developed a generative AI model for realistic text-to-image generation with fine-tuning capabilities.
achievements: Built a generative AI model using Stable Diffusion and LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) techniques to enable high-fidelity text-to-image synthesis.
Optimised GPU training on RTX 3050, strategically reducing VRAM memory usage by 25% through efficient batch processing and model quantization techniques.
Integrated real-time data pipelines to enhance interactive user experience and model responsiveness during generation.

tailored_cvs.job_description:
Job Title:Undergraduate Intern (12 Months) - Software EngineeringAbout Skyhigh Security:Skyhigh Security is a dynamic, fast-paced, cloud company that is a leader in the security industry. Our mission is to protect the world’s data, and because of this, we live and breathe security. We value learning at our core, underpinned by openness and transparency.Since 2011, organizations have trusted us to provide them with a complete, market-leading security platform built on a modern cloud stack. Our industry-leading suite of products radically simplifies data security through easy-to-use, cloud-based, Zero Trust solutions that are managed in a single dashboard, powered by hundreds of employees across the world. With offices in Santa Clara, Aylesbury, Paderborn, Bengaluru, Sydney, Tokyo and more, our employees are the heart and soul of our company.Skyhigh Security Is more than a company; here, when you invest your career with us, we commit to investing in you. We embrace a hybrid work model, creating the flexibility and freedom you need from your work environment to reach your potential. From our employee recognition program, to our ‘Blast Talks' learning series, and team celebrations (we love to have fun!), we strive to be an interactive and engaging place where you can be your authentic self.We are on these too! Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter@SkyhighSecurity.Role Overview:We've an exciting hands-on year-long paid internship working within the Skyhigh Security Data Protection team where you'll learn and contribute to the team as they produce next generation cloud technology to help secure business data from accidental or malicious loss.About the role:Our team develops software that secures against data breaches that can damage organizations, ruin reputations and result in the leakage of personal information. You'll join us in the further development of cloud services that enable our customers to protect their sensitive content. You'll learn new skills and technologies within a supportive agile development team. Your colleagues will work with you, guiding you so that you contribute directly to all aspects of software development, allowing you to build and enhance skills in design, coding, test automation, infrastructure maintenance and support for the production software. Roles exist in teams developing our next generation user interfaces as well as in developing cloud content scanning technologies depending on your skills and interests.About you:Good programming skills using an object-oriented programming language, e.g. Java or C++An ability to solve problems in an efficient mannerAn interest and enthusiasm for working with new technologiesExcellent verbal and written English skillsAn ability to communicate ideas and describe your work using visual aids where appropriateStudying Computer Science, or similar technical discipline that includes significant computer programming contentWorking towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s DegreeProjected grade of 2.1 or aboveEligible to work in the UK

job_analysis.selected_projects_reasoning: Selected 'DocuCare AI' because it directly aligns with the job's emphasis on cloud technologies (Supabase), data protection, and cloud content scanning (AI for OCR, data extraction, RAG). It also demonstrates experience with 'next-generation user interfaces' (Next.js, React). 'Smart Student Job Agent Platform (Unihustle)' was chosen to highlight robust full-stack software development, strong programming skills (Python, Flask, React), complex problem-solving (matching engine, asynchronous processing with Celery/Redis), and scalable architecture, all of which are crucial for a Software Engineering Intern role. Both projects demonstrate an interest in new technologies and practical application of computer science principles.

tailored_cv.professional_summary: Highly motivated and adaptable Software Engineering student with a strong foundation in object-oriented programming (Python, Java, JavaScript), cloud-native development, and modern full-stack architectures. Passionate about solving complex problems efficiently, securing data, and contributing to scalable cloud solutions. Actively pursuing a Master's in Artificial Intelligence to further enhance expertise in innovative technologies. Skilled in applying Agile methodologies across the SDLC, with proven ability to translate business requirements into robust technical solutions and committed to continuous learning within a collaborative environment.
